My AO3

summary: Tyrus fic where they get into a fight over something stupid but Cyrus gets really upset whenever someone yells at him so he...
question: Tyrus fic where they get into a fight over something stupid but Cyrus gets really upset whenever someone yells at him so he starts crying and TJ realizes that he’s made a huge mistake. (Bc I’m a masochist and I need some angst right now)
answer:
Also available on AO3 ♥

TJ couldn’t get the image of Cyrus’ tear-streaked face out of his head. He kept replaying the argument over and over again – desperately trying to figure out how things had spiralled so quickly – and every time he recalled the stricken expression marring his boyfriend’s beautiful face, he felt like throwing up. Cyrus hadn’t deserved any of the horrible words he’d spewed at him, his anger brought on by his own stupidity in the wake of his latest math test.  

“Why do you even bother?” he remembered himself saying – no, screaming – at Cyrus. “I’m a fucking idiot, okay? You can’t fix me! Stop trying to fix me, goddamn it!”

After kicking a cloud of dust into the air, he’d thrown his bag onto the ground and emptied his lungs at the sky, his throat raw from shouting by the time he’d finished. Cyrus had stood quietly on the edge of the park, silent tears streaming down his face as he waited for TJ to calm down.

“Come home with me,” he’d begged. “My mom will make you dinner. We can watch a movie. Please, TJ. I hate seeing you like this.”

“Then go away!” he’d yelled in retaliation, aiming all of his anger at Cyrus in that one, heated moment. The sadness in Cyrus’ eyes had cut him like a knife, but that hadn’t stopped him from saying more. “You don’t even like me, do you? Just admit it! I’m just a fucking project to you, aren’t I? Just say it!”

Cyrus had shrunk back, as if burnt by his words, and wept even harder than before. ”I love you, TJ! You know I do! I just want to help –”

“I don’t need your help! Don’t you get it? I don’t need anyone!”

The rest was a blur. All he remembered was Cyrus reaching forward – cautiously, like TJ was a vicious animal – and squeezing his hand once, briefly, before turning around and walking away. That had been almost three days ago, and he hadn’t spoken to him since.

Without Cyrus to offer him comfort, he retreated to the park, hoping to organise his thoughts and figure things out. But when he arrived, he found the swing set already occupied, a familiar mop of dark hair hiding the other boy’s face. His feet were dragging across the ground, keeping the swing at a slow, steady pace, and TJ could hear the quiet mumbling of a song falling from his lips.

“Legs go up, legs go down. That’s how we make the swing go ‘round. Drag your feet, you go slow. The more you drag, the less you go –”

“Nice song.”

Cyrus looked up at him, his grip instantly tightening on the chains of the swing. It was so reminiscent of the first time they really talked that TJ couldn’t help but smile, his heart pinching with nostalgia. Before he knew what he was doing, he took a step forward, his hand resting on the blue frame, and said, “Chocolate chocolate chip muffin, right?”

For a second, he didn’t think Cyrus was going to play along, but then the younger boy surprised him with a small, tentative smile. “Scary-basketball-guy.”

His lips twitched fondly at the old nickname. “Do you hang out here a lot?”

“Only when I’m feeling bad about myself,” Cyrus said, the humour seeping out of his tone. He returned his eyes to the ground with a noncommittal shrug. “Like when my boyfriend shouts at me for trying to help him, then ignores my calls for three days straight.”

TJ winced. “Cyrus, I… I’m so sorry. You didn’t deserve that. Any of it. I was just embarrassed, okay?”

“You never need to feel embarrassed around me.”

“I know,” he said, wringing his hands together as he dared to sit on the swing next to Cyrus. After a beat of silence, he took his hand and cradled it against his chest, ducking his head to meet Cyrus’ downcast gaze. “I trust you more than anyone, Cy. But even you can’t help me sometimes.” He sucked in a deep breath, his chest growing tight. “When it gets really bad, I lash out at people. And it makes me feel like crap, but I can’t help it. It’s like my mind goes red.”

Cyrus looked up at him with confused, watery eyes. “That’s why I gave you space,” he said. “But then you kept on ignoring my calls… Why didn’t you want to talk to me?”

“Because I knew I’d hurt you.”

“You didn’t think to apologise?”

“I thought you might hate me,” he admitted, squeezing Cyrus’ hand as if it were a stress ball. “I’m not a good person, Cyrus. Not all the time. Not like you are… I guess I was just scared you might’ve figured that out and decided to drop me for good.”

“Don’t say that.”

“Well, I wouldn’t blame you.”

Delicate fingers cupped his jaw and tilted his head upwards, greeting him with the gorgeous – albeit sad – smile of his boyfriend beaming down at him, his bottom lip trembling slightly.  

“Stop doing that,” Cyrus whispered, his soft hands petting the back of his hair. “Stop trying to push me away.”

“I’m not –”

“You don’t think you deserve me, right? That’s what this is all about?”

“Well…”

“You’re such an idiot,” Cyrus murmured, but there was no heat in his words. Instead, a teasing smile dimpled his cheeks as he leaned forward and kissed TJ’s forehead. “You’re a good person,” he said, his lips still pressed against his skin. “Nobody’s perfect, TJ. Me included. And if we really want to make this work, we can’t be afraid to show our imperfections to each other. Do you get what I’m saying?”

TJ swallowed thickly. “Yeah. I think so.”

“I want to be with you, no matter what. Through the bad times as well as the good. You just have to let me.”

“I will.”

“You promise?”

“Yes.” He looped an arm around Cyrus’ waist and tugged him onto his lap, their foreheads closing the gap like a pair of magnets. “I promise I won’t push you away anymore… I can’t stand the thought of losing you.”

Cyrus kissed him softly. “You won’t.”

“I really am sorry, Cy –”

“I know you are.”

“What can I do to make it up to you? Whatever you want, I’ll do it.”

“Just stay with me,” Cyrus said, his eyes fluttering closed as he pressed his cheek against TJ’s chest. “That’s all I want.”

“Okay.” TJ pulled him closer and buried a smile in the crook of his neck. “I can do that.”

“Well, I wouldn’t blame you.”

Delicate fingers cupped his jaw and tilted his head upwards, greeting him with the gorgeous – albeit sad – smile of his boyfriend beaming down at him, his bottom lip trembling slightly.  

“Stop doing that,” Cyrus whispered, his soft hands petting the back of his hair. “Stop trying to push me away.”

“I’m not –”

“You don’t think you deserve me, right? That’s what this is all about?”

“Well…”

“You’re such an idiot,” Cyrus murmured, but there was no heat in his words. Instead, a teasing smile dimpled his cheeks as he leaned forward and kissed TJ’s forehead. “You’re a good person,” he said, his lips still pressed against his skin. “Nobody’s perfect, TJ. Me included. And if we really want to make this work, we can’t be afraid to show our imperfections to each other. Do you get what I’m saying?”

TJ swallowed thickly. “Yeah. I think so.”

“I want to be with you, no matter what. Through the bad times as well as the good. You just have to let me.”

“I will.”

“You promise?”

“Yes.” He looped an arm around Cyrus’ waist and tugged him onto his lap, their foreheads closing the gap like a pair of magnets. “I promise I won’t push you away anymore… I can’t stand the thought of losing you.”

Cyrus kissed him softly. “You won’t.”

“I really am sorry, Cy –”

“I know you are.”

“What can I do to make it up to you? Whatever you want, I’ll do it.”

“Just stay with me,” Cyrus said, his eyes fluttering closed as he pressed his cheek against TJ’s chest. “That’s all I want.”

“Okay.” TJ pulled him closer and buried a smile in the crook of his neck. “I can do that.”

summary: As a gay teenager I'm just gonna say this. Even the subtext helps. It doesn't need to be textual for the entire fandom so long...
question: As a gay teenager I'm just gonna say this. Even the subtext helps. It doesn't need to be textual for the entire fandom so long as it's easily identifiable to gay kids like me, who the story line is actually meant for. I know what TJ's "stuff meant", what the looks and smiles he gave Cyrus meant, the coded ways he dressed and acted, I know what I felt when Cyrus said "there is nothing wrong with you" even if the intent wasn't about TJs sexuality and was validated by the look back and swingset 2.0
answer:
Thank you. It’s refreshing to hear young people defend this show. This is why I always talk about Andi Mack being validating for me, despite the fact that I’m an adult. I did not have that kind of representation just 10-15 years ago when I was in Disney Channel’s target audience. Sure, there were shows on TV, outside of Disney, with gay characters that I watched - but none of them were meant for my age group. Almost all of them sere sexualized or stereotypes. The closest I had to lgbtq rep on Disney Channel was literally Ryan’s trope ass in HSM which got shut down by the time the third movie came out anyways. 

Andi Mack is the first big step towards progress on the network. Sure we’ve seen a brief animated kiss and lesbian moms which is good! But to actually have gay YOUTH represented on a Disney show is incredibly validating for everyone who sees themselves in Cyrus or TJ, whether they are their age or whether they have been fighting for that representation since they were their age. To come along and invalidate that progress just because it isn’t as loud or bold as the LGBTQ+ rep in adult media  or because there are other things going on in the show as well is unfair.

summary: Marty x Leo headcanons 2
body:
Marty x Leo headcanons 2

Got back from my test, nailed it I’m supposed to study for a 4 hours test tomorrow but I’m a wreck so here you goes.


- Marty laughs when he saw Leo, “that’s my luck” he said falling on his bed.

- Leo just kept looking at him like he was on a dream. “ Did he really loved me like love love ??? Omg that can’t be “

- Marty was overwhelm by what just happens at his gf, well ex gf’s house. They had a fight in front of her family over Buffy but that’s dumb, he’s over her. But she didn’t believe him and said that he act like he has someone else on his mind lately.

- Leo finally snap back to the world and decided to leave but Marty whisper “no”, at first Leo taught he was hallucinating but Marty repeated it. So he went to the bed with him.

- They stayed here for what seem like an eternity, they didn’t talk but at a moment Marty started crying and Leo held his hands and started making circle with his thumbs. Just like when they were kids.

- Marty’s moms went to see if everything was okay, Marty felt asleep but Leo was still there, awake holding his hand. He asked them to call his dad to know if he could sleep there, his dad said yes.

- In the morning Marty wake up and tought that everything was a dream, I mean what are the chances that he really felt asleep on his bed with his old crush ?

blog.description:

summary: While I disagree with that other anon about rescinding Andi Mack's existing GLAAD award for season 2 (The coming out scenes and...
question: While I disagree with that other anon about rescinding Andi Mack's existing GLAAD award for season 2 (The coming out scenes and impact on gay teenagers who reached out and told Josh their stories alone justify it), I do agree that it doesn't deserve to win it again this year based solely on the episodes we've seen so far of season 3. GLAAD awards needs to be earned through continual representation and not just one off token moments and I feel season 3 has done a backslide so far compared to 2.
answer:
I’ve seen a lot of people say this and I hadn’t really commented on it yet so let me take a moment to explain this:

The nomination is not for Andi Mack season 3. The submission period for the GLAAD Awards is based on the entire year prior to the ceremony itself. This means that when Andi Mack won an award in 2018, it was winning an award based on the episodes that aired in 2017, which included all of season one and the first 6 episodes of season 2. This year’s award ceremony will be rewarding media that aired last year (2018) - meaning everything between episode 207 (”Head Over Heels”) and 307 (”The New Girls”) was eligible for this nomination. 

This means that Bex’s subtextual advice about “Cyrus in progress”, Cyrus breaking up with Iris, the original swing set scene with TJ, Cyrus coming out to Andi at the Bar Mitzvah, pretty much all of the relationship building with TJ, Cyrus talking about his crush on Jonah changing, and TJ looking back at Cyrus were all scenes taken into account in nominating Andi Mack for the award this year - as well as any moments that happened in 3a. 

This also means that even if Andi Mack does not get renewed for a 4th season, it will still technically be eligible for the award in 2020, based on the 14 episodes airing in 2019. 

Beyond these facts - this is a new category. There are very few children’s shows with LGBTQ+ themes, and Andi Mack has still done more as far as actual education and representation compared to the other shows in the category. We can celebrated the queer agenda and themes of acceptance in the cartoons that are nominated along with Andi Mack - but they aren’t doing quite the same thing as Andi Mack and I think everyone would agree with that. There’s a difference between fantasy queer cartoons and an actual gay middle school student figuring out life. Cyrus’ storyline is still important. Even if a lot of it is subtext. Even if it doesn’t always focus on his sexuality. Even if his relationship is a slow burn. He is normalizing what it means to be gay in middle school, and starting conversations with young people and parents. A gay story is still a gay story even if that’s not all it is, because a gay person is still a gay person even if that’s not all they are.

There’s a difference between fantasy queer cartoons and an actual gay middle school student figuring out life. Cyrus’ storyline is still important. Even if a lot of it is subtext. Even if it doesn’t always focus on his sexuality. Even if his relationship is a slow burn. He is normalizing what it means to be gay in middle school, and starting conversations with young people and parents. A gay story is still a gay story even if that’s not all it is, because a gay person is still a gay person even if that’s not all they are.

12. “You broke my heart and all you can say is sorry?”

____________________________________

Cyrus and TJ had broken up after being together for almost 2 years. It was over the usual TJ got in a fight and didn’t see anything wrong with it bull crap and Cyrus was still pissed. It had all happened at the swings the past saturday after the two boys started arguing about TJ’s priorities.

The wind was picking up and Cyrus could feel himself shivering against the cold breeze. In front of him stood his boyfriend of 11 months, TJ Kippen. The boys had started to get at it when Cyrus had uncovered that TJ had gotten into a fight with a kid at school over some stupid basketball tie up.

“So you’re trying to tell me that this stupid basketball drama gave you enough reason to break a kids nose?” Cyrus asked. He could feel his voice starting to raise at the question but tried his best to keep his voice level.

The boys sat in silence for what seemed like forever before TJ spoke up.

“He was talking smack, he had it coming.” TJ mumbled.

“How am I supposed to feel safe around you when you just beat people up for saying they’re better than you?” Cyrus could definitely feel his voice raising now, “Spoiler alert, Tyler James Kippen,” TJ flinched at the use of his full name,”you’re not the best thing to ever bless this earth!”

“Then why are we doing this?” it was less of a question and more of a challenge.

“I don’t know.”

At those words. Cyrus turned and walked home, tears burning his eyes and streaking his face..

Cyrus was quickly pulled out of his thoughts by a sharp buzz in his pocket. As he pulled the phone out and saw the contact name, he immediately regretted checking it.

TJ: can u please meet me @ the swings after school?

Just as Cyrus went to stuff his phone back into his jacket pocket it vibrated again.

TJ: i know you don’t want to talk to me but please, cy. we need to sort this out.

At that Cyrus exhaled sharply and, cursing his inability to say no to TJ, decided to talk to him.

_________________

The end of school bell rang sharply throughout the hallway as Cyrus shoved the remainder of his books in his locker, grabbed his bag, and headed towards the park. He had, once again, forgot to grab a coat and was shivering as the cold breeze blew against him.

He arrived at the swings at approximately 3:30 and sitting on the swing, back to Cyrus, was TJ. Cyrus immediately felt his heart jump out of his chest and couldn’t think of what to say. Before Cyrus even had a chance to open his mouth, TJ interrupted, voice just above a whisper.

“I’m sorry.” He said. Cyrus could tell he had been crying based on his scratchy voice. The boys sat in silence while Cyrus tried to come up with something to say.

“You broke my heart and all you can say is sorry?” Cyrus tried to muster up the most challenging face he could.

“Look, Underdog-”

“Don’t call me that.” Cyrus interrupted much louder than intended.

“Cyrus, I was an idiot, okay?” Cyrus could hear the hurt in his voice but was trying his hardest to block it out, “You can call it all off and be pissed with me for the rest of your life if you want but I at least want you to know that I’m sorry.”

TJ looked at him with the most pleading eyes he had ever seen and Cyrus could feel himself melting. No, Cyrus. He can’t just do this to you.

At that Cyrus straightened up and spoke to TJ one last time, looking him directly in the eyes and speaking in the most calm and collected voice he could find.

“No. You can’t just screw up then waltz back into my life like nothings wrong! I’m sorry, TJ, but I can’t do this anymore. We’re over.”

Cyrus couldn’t bare to even look at TJ’s face. He quickly turned on his heel and stormed away before the taller boy could respond or try to salvage what he had destroyed. Cyrus could feel tears burning his eyes and kept having to fight back the urge to run back to TJ and apologize and tell him everything was going to be okay. But to be honest with you, it wasn’t. Nothing was okay and it probably never would be. But Cyrus did what he had to do and there was no going back now.

2 years and it’s over just like that,

summary: (i mean this in the nicest way possible) why do you so actively hate wonah? like i get it wasn't meant to be serious but it can...
question: (i mean this in the nicest way possible) why do you so actively hate wonah? like i get it wasn't meant to be serious but it can be cute and people are having fun with it, just like any other crackship. i don't get why you're constantly telling people it sucks and that they're sheeple for shipping it, when it's not like a handful of people shipping wonah is hurting anyone. i'm just genuinely confused
answer: It just really irks me that people are like “wonah>(insert ship here)”, especially because it was never supposed to be an actual ship. And it like bugs me to see it everywhere because it was a joke that we made and wasn’t supposed to be taken seriously?? Like we literally made a social experiment bc we were fucking around in a server and now it’s super popular when it wasn’t even supposed to be a real thing and it just bugs me.
